ygData.subject: Re: So anyone wanna trade...
ygData.msgSnippet: I know this is way old (going thru old email) but 28 is not even close to strong enough to get your own drum, unless you re extremelly lucky. I ended up buying
ygData.messageBody:
I know this is way old (going thru old email) but 28 is not even close to
strong enough to get your own drum, unless you're extremelly lucky.

I ended up buying a chipped bone bracelet for 500 pp and trading that for
the MM Drums.

Darkfox Reven'tsol
Xegony

----- Original Message -----
From: Rob Berryhill <racefan@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, October 31, 1999 5:23 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] So anyone wanna trade...


> From: "Rob Berryhill" <racefan@...>
>
> The Paw is worth WAY more than the drum. On Sol Ro the drum goes for
around
> 250 to 300, the Paw is a TRADE ONLY item that if sold would fetch over
> 1000pp and probably closer to 2000pp.
>
> Astur il'Ayan, Cleric of Brell
> Solusek Ro
>
> > From: "JasonF" <JasonF@...>
> >
> > I'm very close to completing a Paw of Opolla. This is perhaps the best
> > non-Planes item for Clerics, Druids and Shamans (AC 9, STA +5, WIS +9,
AGI
> > +9, MANA +5, SV DISEASE -5 and CHA -5). I started the quest a
> > few weeks ago
> > before we knew about the Lambent quests :-) A 50th Wiz on Fennin Ro the
> > other night was auctioning for trade a MM Battle Drum. I told him I was
> > close to completing the Paw and he offered to trade TWO sets of MM
Battle
> > Drums for the completed Paw. A friend of mine that is familiar
> > with the Wiz
> > says that he bought the drums on ebay, I dunno...
> >
> > What is the consensus? Is this a fair trade? Be it known that
> > I've camped
> > Paw pieces for approximately 25 hours and had to get my baking skill up
as
> > well (and we bards are the brightest bunch). At 28th I think that I'm
> > approaching the level that I would expect to be able to get a MM
> > Battle Drum
> > with my own group. Is this correct?
> >
> > Crier Sharpsong
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
with the subject lol.
>
